main event: On 25th January 1938, a civilian witnessed a round sphere about half the size of a large airliner, traveling northwest, which suddenly vanished and then banked to the right before traveling southeast at a rapid speed. The observation lasted about 5 to 10 minutes.
interesting points: The unidentified object was described as a round sphere about half the size of a large airliner and was observed traveling northwest before suddenly vanishing and then banking to the right and traveling southeast at high speed.

The observation was marked as 'Possibly Aircraft' in the conclusions, but the comments on the report raised the probability that this unidentified observation may not be associated with any technical phenomena.
The report mentions the sound of engines from an airliner overhead and its disappearance in the southeast, fading into the horizon.
The observation noted the presence of one ground visual civilian witness and stated 'Photos: Yes', indicating that photographs of the object were available.
The military communication at the end of the report discussed the coordinates and altitudes of the observed object, suggesting a detailed analysis of the sighting.
sighted object: Round sphere about half the size of a large airliner
